Reviews.Title: “FIRST CLASS”
Reviews.Author: Gags19
Reviews.Content: Great find !. This hotel had everyting: great location,great staff,close to restaurants and golf, quite and clean. A travellers delight !. Wish there were more like this. Faultless.

Reviews.Title: “Save money”
Reviews.Author: washermfg
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fine thought we would try a step up from Hampton but found no advantage for the extra $. Stay at the Hampton instead and buy yourself a nice dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: Mike U
Reviews.Content: I travel every week for work and have stayed in many hotels over the years. I can't say how impressed I was with my recent stay at the Hilton Garden Inn San Diego/Del Mar. The difference between this and other similar class hotels is their attention to detail. The rooms are clean, the property is well-maintained, and the staff is professional. During my most recent visit, I had to leave early in the morning to catch a plane. By 5:30am, the hotel had coffee brewed and available in the lobby.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
Reviews.Title: “Perfect family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Annie G
Reviews.Content: After a few days in Vegas, we checked in to this hotel. Everything about our stay was FANTASTIC! We were road-tripping with 3 kids and meeting extended family in the area. The staff was so guest-oriented. They took care of all our annoying requests with such grace. The food was wonderful and very-reasonably priced. We ate more than half our meals in the hotel because it was so convenient! The pool is small but was perfect for our little family. Love, love, love this place. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and convenient to UC San Diego”
Reviews.Author: calgrads
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn on a trip to visit UC San Diego. The room was clean and very pleasant. It was a comfortable size for the three of us. The service throughout our stay was excellent. Also, a full hot breakfast was reasonably priced for hotel guests. Our only small complaints were that the ethernet was unusually slow. It was free, but sluggish! And, there were no movie channels.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Urmi U
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton for 3 nights with a 3 year old and 10 month old. The staff was very accommodating with our requests and house cleaning did a great job. The room was bigger than I expected and comes with a fridge and microwave. It's a very family friendly room and has a great breakfast buffet and made to order entrees. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Service but...”
Reviews.Author: MaypoJMV
Reviews.Content: This hotel would get five stars except their Internet service is horrible. I have stayed here around once a month for years. The staff is always fantastic, rooms are clean and the atmosphere is professional and welcoming. Truly a home away from home. But the simplest task on the internet slows to a crawl. As a professional programmer the internet service is essentially unusable for anything beyond reading news. YouTube or other video cannot be used. Downloading an attachment on an email will take forever - and forget remote desktop over VPN. I will continue to stay at this location now that I read that the are fixing the service but I will find another hotel if it does not support all of the above services in the next trip or two.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wassilik k
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great locattion within walking distance of most of the major attractions of the city. The rooms were tastefully decorated, and the staff was unfailingly charming and helpful plus all the facilities. By choosing this hotel, you can be assured of having a wonderful experience in this marvelous city.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but....”
Reviews.Author: QuinnEskimo
Reviews.Content: First off, I really do like this hotel. I've stayed there several times. It is very nice, clean and well decorated. The staff is the friendliest around. They remembered my name and said, "Hello" or "Good Morning" every time they saw me. The housekeepers don't disturb your belongings but clean the room very well. The reason I have marked this location as average is because of their internet and cell service. The wireless internet is terrible. It could not be slower. Trying to get work down is extremely frustrating. Also, the cell phone connectivity is just as terrible. I am not sure if the local terrain plays a factor in that or not, but the hotel really needs a cell repeater to boost the signal. I lost service many times in the conference room with my iPhone. I really hate to rate the hotel the way I have because it is so fantastic in so many ways, but if you are on travel for business and need a steady, half-way decent wireless capability or strong cell connectivity, you might want to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Super clean, Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: Duke330
Reviews.Content: Rooms were freshly renovated and clean. Service was extremely friendly. It's where I'm staying when I came back to this area. On-site spa was a unexpected feature for an HGI.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Steve B
Reviews.Content: From the time I checked in until I left for the airport, every person I came in contact with was pleasant and welcoming. I really felt as though they all were happy that I was there. I would reccomend staying here to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: dbergren
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on a vacation to the San Diego area. We had enough points to stay for four nights and found it to be very comfortable and clean. There are only a few small things that they could improve on such as the television not going on when first powered up. This seems to be a problem with other hotels in this line. A free breakfast would be great also but since they don't offer one then a bigger fridge in the room would be nice. The bed was very comfy as were the pillows. We had a nice private balcony too.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality plus”
Reviews.Author: doctorfat
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights to see show at La Jollla Playhouse. Staff were outstanding. Had the breakfast included and this was well worth the price. Best hotel breakfast in town. Staff were outstanding. Free parking and lots of space. Rooms clean and good size. Beds were great. Form the price, this is an outstanding hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've Stayed at for a Long Time!”
Reviews.Author: Lilypony
Reviews.Content: Rarely do I feel the need to even write a review - never mind such a glowing one and never mind before I've even checked out! Staff here are amazing, so friendly and helpful and although it is a sizeable hotel, they know who you are and remember your room number. Rooms lovely, restaurant fantastic and facilities really nice. I could not recommend this hotel highly enough if you are staying in the Del Mar / La Jolla area of San Diego, for business or pleasure. It was fantastic from start to finish.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place”
Reviews.Author: Evan H
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay. We came here for three days to take in the Wild Animal Park (25 minutes away) and Sea World (15 minutes away). All staff are very knowledgable, friendly and helpful. Very clean hotel and room. The manager was willing to exchange several emails before we booked the room. Thier willingness to answer all of our questions was one of the reasons we booked here. The only negatives I have is that the adjustable bed was too firm even at the softest setting (I like softer) and there is no ice machine on the third floor. Neither of these are showstoppers. Breakfast is a help-yourself bar and a menu where you can get a fresh, hot meal. The made-to-order breakfast has generous portions and are quickly prepared. The breakfast here is far better than any Denny's or Ihop around. Fresh, free, cookies at the check-in desk every afternoon while they last. Our daughter loved that part.

Reviews.Title: “Little Touches”
Reviews.Author: oicrnow
Reviews.Content: We went to HGI Del Mar for a family vacation. We elected to upgrade to the Bed and Breakfast for an additional $6. It was a really great idea as we were able to have a full breakfast before launching on for our days of adventure. I love to stay at HGI. It is great that these hotels have figured out that the reason I am staying at a hotel is that I want a good bed and a good shower. The HGI Del Mar provided both. The staff was pleasant and courteous and the nightly cookie that HGI provides is just a nice welcome home touch.

Reviews.Title: “Executive Chef in the house!”
Reviews.Author: italcanerman
Reviews.Content: As many other reviews mention I can also confirm the quality of the rooms (excellent) and overall appearance of the hotel (very well maintained) and this is certainly seems the result of being privately owned by hard working and hands on proprietors. What is most out of the ordinary though (for this type of hotel) is the quality and variety of the food served in Bistro 39 including the excellent a la carte breakfast which added only $6.00 to our overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Terrie T
Reviews.Content: We planned a celebration of life for 50 people at the Hilton Garden Inn Del Mar. Everything exceeded our expectations. The room was set up beautifully. We had a luncheon and the food was hot and excellent. The LCD player, sound system, podium, and microphone were all properly set up and worked great. The catering administrator I worked with (Diane Phan) listened carefully to make sure that everything went smoothly. All the details were planned out and taken care of so that we could focus on the day's events. The staff were all attentive, but not intrusive. The feedback from our guests was all positive. I highly recommend this facility. We were very happy!

Reviews.Title: “kevin@404creative.com”
Reviews.Author: kflahaut
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the strength of the reviews and I was not at all disappointed. The accommodations were very comfortable and the staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. I especially wanted to commend the young lady Daniela at the front desk for going out of the way to get me into just the right room. The hotel is a bit off the beaten path in a very nice residential area. It's still just a short drive up the highway to just about anywhere you'd like to go so it wasn't a problem. I personally enjoyed the quiet atmosphere the location provided. The restaurant was pretty good as well. The didn't have a huge menu, but what I tried was very good. I'd happily recommend the "grown up grilled cheese" with the side salad if you decide to visit the bistro. This was also one of the few hotel "gyms" that I've visited that actually have working equipment. Beyond that, the gym actually has very nice, updated cardio equipment with a small assortment of medicine balls and dumbbells for resistance training. The gym is accessible 24 hours so it was easy to find a time to get a workout in. Overall my week-long stay was very pleasant and when I return to San Diego you can bet this hotel will be on my list of places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Great”
Reviews.Author: Maxion
Reviews.Content: After my eleventh stay there, I have finally decided to write a review. First stay was shortly after they opened and my most recent stay was just before Thanksgiving for four nights. Even though there are large time frames between my visits, I am constantly recognized by name and given a pleasant "welcome back" when I check in. The place looks like it was just built as it is maintained very well. Housekeeping is outstanding. Room service is very prompt and the food is excellent. Sorry to say but I have never had a complaint in all of my stays (how it should be) so I cannot comment on how the staff would respond. Any request I have had has been honored immediately. Being a gold member for a long time, this is by far one of the best properties the chain if not the best. Thanks for always giving me a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: slosh26
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, comfortable rooms, very good restaurant and wonderfull staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Garden Inn. Well managed, immaculately maintained.”
Reviews.Author: JolietJakeBlues
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend while in San Diego for a funeral. The hotel is well run, with friendly, helpful staff. The rooms and common areas are clean and well maintained. The room, furniture and bed were all comfortable. As others have mentioned, the ventilator fans run all the time and do make some noise. I had a perfectly good stay here. It's a Garden Inn, so you can't expect the Ritz. But it's really quite good and comfy. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Hard bed”
Reviews.Author: Freechild7
Reviews.Content: This is THE most uncomfortable bed I have EVER slept on. It is now 3am and my back hurts and my skin is raw from the sheets.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: msakhrani
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure how out of the way it is in San Diego.. I was there for business, but the hotel is pretty nice. The restaurant /bar has great food and I definitely enjoyed the little time I was in the hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Simple, Clean, and a Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: tjm0831
Reviews.Content: I booked a double bed and was surprised how spacious the rooms were. I enjoyed every minute of the hotel from the service rep, the lobby decor, cleanness, and the size of each room. I would definitely come here again and enjoy it with peace and mind.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend it”
Reviews.Author: CdelP
Reviews.Content: A small hotel with clean rooms, comfortable bed and great staff. Restaurant has very good food and reasonably priced. I find myself eating dinner there even when I am not staying at the hotel. I've also recommended the restaurant to business associates in the area. They have cookies in the evening by the front desk... a good end to a busy day.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Joanne C
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at this hotel. Our experience was consistent with the other reviews. The staff was very friendly. The room was very clean -- spotless. Everything seemed brand new. Mini fridge and microwave in the room was convenient. The bed was very comfortable and we were able to create our own comfort settings. They have Nutrogena products in the bathroom. We ate dinner at the restaurant. Service was very good. Limited menut but something for everyone. They bake cookies every night. The workout room was small but had all the basics - treadmill, stair stepper, recumbrant, free weights, ball. Also very clean. Didn't use the pool or jacuzzi but they appeared to be very clean as well. Located just a few minutes from the freeway exit. Will stay there again next time we go to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, top notch stay”
Reviews.Author: Kelly D
Reviews.Content: Booked an extra night we liked this place so much. A little out of the way but the privacy and "exclusive" feel of the location made this a desireable hotel. On the more expensive side for a room in the San Diego area but if you have wheels, it's a really nice place. One caveat - upstairs neighbors can be heard so ask for a top floor room.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: IdahoMarilla
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a week there. The staff was very helpful with directions, and maps. The restaurant staff as well as the evening bartender were extremely nice. I dropped my wallet in the elevator filled with vacation cash and it was returned to me completely in tact. The only difficult thing about the place is getting there from the airport. Also be aware that there are two Hiltons in Del Mar, but only one of them is the Garden Inn, can be confusing.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value by the Interstate”
Reviews.Author: vwhk
Reviews.Content: We booked our 2-day stay at the last-minute on the internet, based on good travelers reviews and an attractive rate. This is a typical high-end motel, accessed in a couple of minutes drive from the I-5. The surroundings are quiet, while offering no specific attraction. The location is convenient for a visit to La Jolla or the UCSD campus and works well for a stop on a road trip. It is not as good as a base for tourism into San Diego: about 30 minutes to downtown, on the Interstate at off-peak hours. The other guests we could see appeared to be on business rather than tourists. Our room was comfortable and large, with two excellent queen-size beds. No traffic noise, fast Wifi internet access, professional and efficient service. We ordered room service on one occasion and were satisfied with prompt delivery and good food quality. We also found the breakfast buffet hearty and inexpensive. As to the style of the place, it is best described as no-nonsense and unpretentious. Bottom line: the hotel delivers exactly what it promises and lives up to the reputation of the brand.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable quality”
Reviews.Author: ConstantTravelerVA
Reviews.Content: I like the HGI brand, because it offers good quality at moderate prices. This hotel delivered as expected. The staff helped me pick restaurants and find my way around the place. This is not exactly a beach property or a SD downtown attraction, but you can easily get to I-5. The rooms are very well-appointed and clean. I didn't use the pool, but it was obviously popular with other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent Service and Comfort and Convienience”
Reviews.Author: traveltect
Reviews.Content: My 4th stay at this conveniently located yet semi-secluded HGI was as expected--great. This is my "go-to" chain hotel in San Diego, partially because I'm a HH gold member, and mainly because its a great property, with very comfortable beds, rooms with everything you need; microwave, refrigerator, HBO, desk. Professional service is available if you need it and privacy is available if you prefer to be left alone. There is even a spa on property should you desire pampering. The small work-out room gets the job done, the pool is ample sized for a cool-off, and an adjacent jacuzzi is comforting. The Lobby Bar/Restaurant is good, with a fireplace, and there is always free coffee/tea and cookies available. And finally, ample free parking.

Reviews.Title: “One of the cleanest, quiet hotels I have stayed in during my 30 years of travel with great breakfast very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Hillbillytravel
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay and would definitely stay there again if ever back in San Diego.Front desk staff extremely nice- great breakfast inlet- fresh fruit, great service. Heated pool which was very clean. Room clean and quit. Quiet location but easy Acess to I-5.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Mezhead
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel! Clean, excellent ammenities and friendly staff. Will always stay here when in the area.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: lrothlaube
Reviews.Content: Loved the beds, roomy rooms, delicious breakfast,helpful staff and centrally located to visit San Diego and La Jolla.. Loved it and would return in a heartbeat. Herb and Lydia

Reviews.Title: “My favorite choice in area for business travel”
Reviews.Author: JTVohana
Reviews.Content: Hilton Gardens overall tend to be nice, moderately priced choices for business, and the Del Mar property has some extra touches. Like most in the chain, rooms are spacious, nicely furnished for the business traveller, and feature a comfortable signature bed. The bistro style restaurant is more interesting than the basic "American Grill" found at most others in the chain. And there are many good restaurants within a five minute drive..ask at the desk. The hotel even has a spa..a somewhat curious additon for this type of hotel. Slightly off the freeway (get directions your first time coming here), but is easy once you know the slightly confusing freeway layout here. I've stayed here many times, and this is my top choice for business travel in the La Jolla/Del Mar area. Would be nice place for vacationing couples as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Experience, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Andrew C
Reviews.Content: Got back from a couple night stay with my family last week. Overall was very impressed with this hotel and the attentive staff. We choose this hotel for its proximity to several attractions within the San Diego area and easy access to the freeways. The rooms and ambinece delivered. We were greeted with fresh cookies, and shown to our well appointed rooms upon arival. The management facilitated our special requests and were attentive to our needs in a timely fashion. We enjoyed breakfast onsite, it was delicious and affordably priced. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great time in a wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: Jordan W
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Garden Inn was great, it was a wonderful location for our family and we had a wonderful time there. The staff was courteous and I definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “This was a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Gary W
Reviews.Content: We had seven rooms for a family reunion, including 22 people. Our stay could not have been more enjoyable. The rooms were good sized and we needed a couple of connecting rooms. We were concerned that we might be a little noisy, but even we could hear our own group. The staff at the front desk, in the restaurant and housekeeping were pleasant, friendly and helpful. We particularily enjoyed the breakfast and the quality of the food was excellent. We were a little concerned that we might run into the race track crowd, but even with a nearly full hotel....we didn't feel crowded. The hotel provides better than expected value. The entire experience was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Always comfortable and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Ken N
Reviews.Content: Fourth time staying here in past month for business trips. Have eaten dinner and breakfast at Bistro 39, lunch at NY Garden Deli & Cafe, always walked away pleased with food, service and value. Have also had multiple group/customer lunches delivered from the Deli & Cafe (order the brownies before they sell out). Workout room is small, clean and usually not crowded. Few dining options within walking distance, but Del Mar and La Jolla are just a 5-minute drive away. Will definitely keep coming back. Like all HGI's that I've patronized - well-trained and eager staff, clean/comfortable rooms w/ microwave/fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: Pam1015
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Garden Inns as we we were going to a concert at the Del Mar Fairgrounds. The rooms were exceptionally clean, large and comfortable . What a bed! All the employees went out of their way to be friendly & helpful. Great "happy hour" on Saturday and Sunday. Great breakfast deal for $10.95. Cons were that it was about 6 miles from fairgrounds in isolated area. We arrived right after 2 p.m. when deli closed and only food was fast food few miles away.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: kuuru
Reviews.Content: I stayed here once before as it is convenient to our customer's location. Great staff, very friendly. We arrived very late, almost 1 am, and the staff we encountered upon check in was very friendly. Room was clean and comfy. Gym was nice although not too many machines. However, both times I went it was empty. Breakfast was good, standard HGI breakfast. No complaints! Great for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: Nitroxprt
Reviews.Content: A very nice well maintained property. Check inn staff were very friendly and pleasant. I had dinner and breakfast in the on property restaurant, and both were fine. Restaurant staff provided great service. This property is located in a quite residential/commerical mixed use area. I heard no traffic/city noise throughout the evening. It is a short distance from Interstate 5 and and very easy to access. I would stay here again and will when I return to the area

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel - great service and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Welly_China_Girl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 10 days for work. Great friendly service from the front desk and housekeeping (spotless). Room amenities great for business trips - wired and wireless internet, lots of light, and good desk and chair setup. Free carparking (I think) and you will need a car as there is nothing nearby. There is a restaurant and bar downstairs, both close at around 9pm most nights. Service and food in the restaurant was generally good. We had the buffet breakfast included in our rate, which made it good value. Front desk staff good at recommending nearby restaurants and directions. Would definitely recommend and would stay here again. In-house laundry on 2nd floor - need to buy laundry powder from pantry ($1.50) and then 6 quarters for the washer and 4 quarters for the dryer. Didn't try the pool or gym (24-hours). Or the day spa. Only 4 very very minor issues: 1) bathroom ventilation is quite noisy and constant (but I guess I got used to it) 2) lack of boiling kettle for a cup of tea (perculator and microwave provided, awkward for those who drink tea). 3) Lack of utensils in room for when you purchase a frozen meal from the lobby pantry (not even a spoon!). 4) Lifts very slow. There are stairs, but these lead you outside so you have to walk around the building to come in.

Reviews.Title: “great property”
Reviews.Author: 230green
Reviews.Content: Property was in great condition and we felt welcome from check in. Customer service was excellent from the front desk to restraunt service. Pool was clean and relaxing after a day of sightseeing. Did not use the spa or exercise room, but they looked wonderful. Couldn't ask more from a hotel. We would definately stay here again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: azgirl2
Reviews.Content: I recently took a course at UCSD that required me to travel to Del Mar once a month for 8 months. This place is the best. The rooms are clean and comfortable, and include a microwave and fridge. The staff is friendly, and the restaurant was a pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it here! Clean Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: shwang17
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a conference and loved it. The rooms were spacious, clean and modern. Parking was complementary. Coffee and water and wi-fi were also free. Hotel was located about 10 miles from downtown San Diego in a nice quiet suburb in Torrey Pines. We didn't mind the easy drive to downtown San Diego since the commute was fairly easy and given the suburban location, i felt like we got better bang for our buck with the hotel. Front desk was very helpful when we asked about road closures from the San Diego Marathon. Breakfast was $10.95 and included an all you can eat semi buffet. There was a menu you could order from (which included omelette, breakfast burritos, and sandwiches, as well as a serve yourself counter with bagels, waffles and fruit. We would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: LAM101
Reviews.Content: I frequently stay in the HGI Del Mar when I am in town on business-- frequent enough to call it my home away from home! I am always impressed-- The rooms are clean, the restaurant is great and the staff is AMAZING! I have yet to have a bad experience! They are my benchmark when I check into other hotels! You can't go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “For 3 Stars, it felt like a 5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aimtuna
Reviews.Content: I normally don't stay at anything less than at minimum 4 star Hotels, but this one rocked it!! The service is superb, the employees are amazing, great restaurant, and quiet area. The room is very clean and the bed is great. They even give you Neutrogena to use! Comes with many amenities such as free wi-fi, FREE PARKING, microwave, and refrigerator! Great place to stay. Don't think since it's a 3 Star, you will be staying at a mediocre Hotel. The general manager, Matt Seamans, knows how to run this place great!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the Best”
Reviews.Author: TFopinion
Reviews.Content: I tend to be a critical reviewer but this HGI was without a doubt the most well managed property I've ever stayed in. As you will read below, I'm at a loss to offer many 'opportunities for improvement' because of the superb quality of the management team here. Rooms were spacious, well appointed, quiet and VERY clean - just what every traveler wants. Unfortunately, I'm not a fan of their select comfort beds - they have a tendency to hollow out in the middle and found them uncomfortable. Loved Bistro 39 - foodservice was outstanding - didn't have one meal we didn't love. We ate breakfast there twice and dinner every night. Why go out when the food is so good, the selections so varied, you have great staff waiting on you and a good game is on the TV. Suggestion: offer draft beer. But what really makes this property top notch is the staff - very engaging and always aiming to please. SPECIAL THANKS: housekeeping for such a clean room, the cooks at Bistro 39 for such well prepared meals, Genevieve, our outstanding and always with a smile server (thanks for the extra cookies), David, whose pleasant personality and desire to be impactful was refreshing and Matt, the GM, who makes the whole ship run so well. We noticed and were impressed that you are such an engaged GM that helps out the rest of the staff whenever the need arises. Thanks for finding us that hard to find table at the bar our 1st night. You and your team do make a difference. So for those readers reading this and haven't decided where to book, STAY HERE. You will be impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: SteelerJeff
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 3 times and love the atmosphere and friendly staff. It is the best kept secrete in San Diego. It is driving distance to all locals and a great value. The morning breakfast is fast and yummy!!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: marJR77
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, quiet location, beautiful rooms. everything looked great from the time we checked in till we left. housekeeping staff was very friendly. look forward to returning soon!

Reviews.Title: “puzzled”
Reviews.Author: zonie0531
Reviews.Content: I would like to thank Del Mar Staff for a great stay, everyone was pleasant and courteous, HOWEVER, the Serenity Spa had a staff member that was engaging in politics and was demeaning towards my gf and I because we were from Arizona and she disagreed with Senate Bill 1070. Was does this have to do with gettting a pedicure? We did not appreciate this at all. We felt totally disrespected and I reported her. Jessica was great and refunded our treatments, however I dont feel that the HIlton should be hiring people that are sharing their political views w/guests and treating them badly. Shame on HER. I would stay at the Hilton again if they offered us a complimentary stary which will probably not happen.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Garden Inn.....”
Reviews.Author: s2w3
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was very pleasant and helpful. The restaurant food was ok. The room service needs improvement. The overall stay was nice, and we would stay there again. The one thing that really bithered me, though, was although the 2 breakfast waitresses appeared caring and friendly, they could be heard talking to each other and complaining about the customers. Once, my 13 year old daughter walked up to the beffet and overheard them even talking about her and how they had to ask her 3 times what she wanted. Which, was not even true. the waitress asked her for hewr order and my daughter very ploitely told her she wasn't ready yet. It was hurtful for her to be depicted like that. She is probably the most polite and well mannered 13 year old there is and is often complimented for her manners. The waitresses shouldn't be talking about their customers like that anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel, Great breakfasts, look forward to stay again”
Reviews.Author: World_Traveler58349
Reviews.Content: I was on business, great hotel, quiet and great breakfasts. I appreciate the quiet to plan for next day meetings and to unwind from long day. I needed the great breakfasts to get started for long day of meetings. Look forward to stay at this hotel again for future trips to San Diego. Reasonable prices too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: greattraveller2011
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, excellent staff, rooms are spacious, free internet access and also great breakfast deals.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: BVT_71
Reviews.Content: The hotel gave away my room, despite my having a reserved a room in advance through a major travel agency. To make matters worse they sent me to a nerby hotel that was a throwback to the sixties, and "had only one room left" that smelled like a smoking room. All this after I arrived after a long day at the office, needing rest for an early meeting in the morning. I would not recommend this hotel to any business traveller!

Reviews.Title: “The most accomodating staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: chc4134
Reviews.Content: The staff was terrific. We were there for the Golf Tournament and they did everything possible to make our stay great; shuttle rides to and from the tournament, recommendations on restaurants and places to see and directions for everything. Thank you and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “What you'd expect from a Garden Inn.”
Reviews.Author: kcboy
Reviews.Content: All in all, I felt like the majority of previous reviews have hit the spot on this place. I'll just go through some of the main points: Location: if you don't want to be right next to the beach, this is a good place. As others have said, it's in more of a business area, well away from the ocean. (When I jogged to Torrey Pines State Beach, it took just more than 3 miles.) The good thing about this is it was a quiet place. No children, mostly business people. So that was nice. It takes 15-20 minutes to get to the Gaslight Quarter from here. Also about a 15 minute drive to get to Del Mar Beach. Accommodations: standard Garden Inn. No better or worse than what I've been from other places. We did have an issue with a couple ants in the room. But that was about all. Amenities: pool and hot whirlpool. Both were fine, though the whirlpool was a bit sudsy. Decent fitness center with treadmill, recumbent bike, a few weights. What I liked about it was a restroom is attached to it, so you don't have to go looking for one. Fitness center could use a fan, though. Restaurant: they've got one, but I didn't use it. The first night, we were told it was closed for an event. Later learned the event was an off-site staff party. Which was fine, but it would've been nice to be told when reserving that it'd be closed. The second night we were there, it was very, very busy. Staff: again, standard Garden Inn. If there's one recommendation I'd give them, it's to remember that the business center is attached to their offices. So customers using the business center will hear everything that's being said in the office. Also, for travelers, be aware that there's no Hilton Honors recognition, if that's important to you. All in all, a decent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for weekend, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: jooles_p
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a family function and picked this hotel for its proximity to the event and price. The rooms are very comfortable, restaurant and bar are very good -- even better than many more expensive hotels I have stayed in for work. It seems very well-maintained. Special thank yous to Joanne at check in and Chanda in the bar for making us feel so welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: freqtrav002
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel quite often. Location is good, and I like Hilton brand, but the reason I keep coming is the staff is the friendliest and most accomodating staff I have ever dealt with. The staff makes an effort to always address you by name, get to know you, and will make sure you are happy and comfortable during your stay. The only thing lacking is their fitness center is small, real small, but the equipment is at least newer/nice.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with good staff”
Reviews.Author: ZoneChicago
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a weird exhaust/ventilation system that generates a slight hum / noise which a person like me who is light sleeper caused problems. Their in room AC/Heater is also pretty noisy so that didn't help either. The walls are pretty thin and we could hear the elevator chime in our room. The staff did try us to move to different rooms but they were fully booked and had limited number of choices and we end up settling on the second room we moved. Bathroom and the hotel room were both clean. Overall, if you are a light sleeper like me, find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best we've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: lamperr
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hilton Garden Inn. The pillows were so good, we bought ourselves some just like them as soon as we got home. The only drawback we felt was that breakfast was not included.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, friendly service. Loved the Breakfast. Kids Loved the pool”
Reviews.Author: Isaac_Loven
Reviews.Content: We loved our 10 day stay and found the location to be in a very safe area. The breakfast was the best of any hotel I have been to. Lots of fresh fruit, many healthy cerials to choose and lots of choices in the cooked breakfast menu, that even the kids enjoyed ( aged 5 and 8 ) ( We loved the vegitarian omlet, made to order) . The pool and spa were perfectly clean, and temperature spot on. Due to location I recommend a hire car, and parking is free. 15 minutes drive from Seaworld / Legoland ( Must do if you have kids ) Suggestion if you have kids: bring a night light - I did not like waisting power by leaving the bathroom light on. Isaac Loven - Melbourne. PS: We attended a Bar-Mitzvah at the hotel. The Food and Service was outstanding, and I saw the staff was very busy ensuring it all went smoothly. ( Best chicken I have had in a long time! )

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: Milanstyle99
Reviews.Content: I am a world traveler and this hotel has great rooms, good service and was very clean,great beds, great breakfast option, in my opinion the only thing they could improve on is having a magnified mirror in bathroom and at check out they should ask about how your stay was, all I got was my statement and that was it not even a question about my stay, they are almost great.

Reviews.Title: “Stands out amidst chain hotels”
Reviews.Author: sam_and_jaime
Reviews.Content: Had stayed at the (related) Homewood Suites for the week preceding this - Wished I'd stayed the whole week here. Competant staff, no-fuss check in/out. Very quiet, modern hotel in a residential area. We know the neighbourhood quite well (friends nearby) so there's no problem running, walking and exploring down to Torrey Pines / the Beach (~30 mins walk) or to the farms/trails along the Sorrento Valley (~15 mins walk away). There's a big plaza down up the hill (Carmel Mountain Rd) to get groceries, snacks, DVDs and coffee. Community center/swimming pool at Carmel Creek.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet gem in a residential area”
Reviews.Author: jwthere4u
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were attending a concert in San Diego and were planned to stay in the Mission Bay area. However, we had to leave early the following morning so wanted to stay further up the highway. I saw all the great reviews of this hotel, and they were right. It's only three years old, so all areas very new. Kevin at the front desk was extremely helpful and printed out driving directions to the venue for us. Any question we had, he answered with patience, and didn't make us feel as though we were taking up his time. We grabbed mahi mahi tacos during Happy Hour in the bar area and they were very good and reasonably priced. Room was nice-pillows and bed were very comfortable. We were not able to use the pool or workout facilities but they looked nice and I liked the option of bringing workout items to your room. The only drawback is the lack of late night dining options. We got out of the concert by 10:30 on a Saturday night only to find both the dining room and room service were closed. I can see the dining room being closed but room service? We tried searching for late options by just driving around the area but it is in a very quiet residential area-great for sleeping, but for eating after 10pm-not so much. We finally grabbed our phones and located the nearest Taco Bell (about a mile away.) Breakfast buffet was fine (I knew there weren't other options close by!) Cold items are buffet style and for the hot items you order whatever you like off the menu. Free wifi, free parking, flat screen TVs, noon check out and clean, new facilities make this a great option for the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “New, roomy, comfortable, accommodating”
Reviews.Author: WWwalker
Reviews.Content: Warning: food, drink and room service stops at 9 or 10 pm. Bring food or by from the pantry for a late night snack. Otherwise it was a perfectly lovely 4 day weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: CeleronPhoenix
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to the freeway and in an upscale residential area. I was pleasantly surprised to find free parking, free wireless internet, free usage of the business center, and a small fitness room. I have stayed in Manchester Grand Hyatt (more expensive option) during my last trip in San Diego, and the rooms in both hotels are very much alike. I will definitely recommend this hotel to my friends. BTW, the front desk staff was very friendly and polite. Overall, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beds are very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: zenff
Reviews.Content: Nice room. Great tub, shower, and decor. Wonderful beds. Very convenient if what you're interested in is north of San Diego ... La Jolla, Del Mar, Solano Beach, Torrey Pines and Encinitas and the Asian restaurants. You have to have a car to get to places.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Value”
Reviews.Author: wtloeb
Reviews.Content: I travel a great deal for business and this was my first stay at this hotel. It offers a full service restaurant, Health Spa and is only three years old. It has the feel of a 5 star property. The staff from reception to food servers was first rate. This property is located north of San Diego but only a short drive to downtown. This property is a hidden gem. I will always stay at this property when visiting greater San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service!”
Reviews.Author: brooke4528
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed in this hotel for a week. We were pleasantly surprised by the size and quality of the rooms. We also enjoyed time at the pool and excellent food at their restaurant Bistro 39 (great happy hour specials too!). I also utilized the business center with free printing. What really stood out however, was the great customer service. Every staff member we encountered was exceptionally nice and helpful. There were a few situations that they went above and beyond our expectations and made our experience really feel more like a resort than the a typical hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret in San Diego Area”
Reviews.Author: Travelalldtime
Reviews.Content: Great location- close to (less than 10 minutes by car) to beach, mall, torrey pines, la jolla, aquarium etc. The staff was very friendly and went out of their way to make sure we had a relaxing and enjoyable weekend. This is the only hotel for miles with a restaurant, spa, and swimming pool on site. The staff went out of their way to make sure the "extra" ammenities that I asked for. Bistro 39, the on site restaurant had delicious food. The made to order breakfast was perfect! The Spa was wonderful. This was a great place to stay. We will definitely be back

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: IRIS54
Reviews.Content: I am a business traveler and found the Hilton Garden Inn very business traveler friendly. They have a business center where you can print, copy, surf, use office supplies, i.e. stapler, scotch tape, envelopes, FedEx and Ups shipping supplies, as well as different size paper for printing different size documents as well as a system that allows you to print from your own laptop, FOR FREE!!!! Most business centers charge internet charges plus printing charges just to print a single boarding pass. It is a relief to stay somewhere where they understand the needs of the business traveler. The hotel is clean, friendly, food is good, and the staff is friendly and efficient. They even have beach equipment to rent for the weekend... I love staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the coziness & great Happy Hour menu/prices”
Reviews.Author: Julie R
Reviews.Content: Beds were comfy, cozy hotel, clean, great friendly and helpful staff. Food was delicious and worth the money. Happy Hour menu 7 days a week from 4pm-7pm. Fresh cookies at the front desk, coffee, water and tea out for the taking. Free Parking. Sitting area with fireplace. Smaller but sufficient pool and jacuzzi. Neutrogena bath products. Mellow, nice decor, chill 24 hour fitness center. Spa, hair and nail salon connected to the hotel but suggest making reservations. They had available a Continental Breakfast for $5.95. My aunt said it was an incredible plethura of food, fruits, etc. They also have a full breakfast for $10.95 Mini fridges AND a microwave in each room! We were here due to my dads hospital stay but the hotel was easy to get in and out of. Not a huge hotel where it takes ya 20 minutes to walk to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Quality of the food was a pleasant surprise.”
Reviews.Author: brinyside
Reviews.Content: Nice place, great beds, quiet rooms, close to La Jolla and Del Mar. We tend to shy away from eating dinner at hotels, but had had a long day and decided to give it a try. The food was fresh and delicious! Our waiter was very good and the front desk staff were helpful and pleasant to deal with.

Reviews.Title: “A bit off the beaten path but well worth the effort”
Reviews.Author: OurTravelsGA
Reviews.Content: We have an office very near this hotel and I use it frequently. The staff always remembers me and while I'm usually a Marriott person, I prefer this Hilton over the Marriotts in the area. The staff is always very kind and actually remember my name when I return. Great service and I continue to use this hotel and will in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Giddy Up! Hit the superfecta at this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: superfectaman
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Del Mar for a vacation of horseracing, beaches, food and fun, we struck it rich staying at this hotel. From the moment we checked in, customer service at the front desk was extended throughout our stay. Each host/hostest went out of their way explaining directions to favorite beaches and restaurants. They even offered several options for our daily 5K run, providing us with maps showing us the course of our choice. Rooms were clean, quiet and comfortable. Parking was free and ample. WiFi was free and fast. Business center was free and modern in working condition. In addition each room had micro/fridge units to keep our snacks fresh. Thanks for an enjoyable stay!! The cost of the room was very reasonable allowing me to bet big on Zenyatta at the horsetrack!!! thanks

Reviews.Title: “Very, Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: StatenIslandGabby
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for the last four days of a pacific coast highway trip. I have to say that this hotel was wonderful. Very clean, nice and comfortable rooms. There were four of us in the room, two teenagers and we had enough room. The employees of this hotel are wonderful. They offered great advice for restaurants in the area and directions. Printed everything for us. There was always a very friendly greeting when entering or exiting the hotel. If visiting the San Diego area again I would definitely stay at this hote.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel nestled away in quiet neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: lapsrus
Reviews.Content: Hilton Garden Inns are usually better than average business hotels, and this one is no exception. Nice greeting upon entry and exit, nice clean quiet room and wi-fi that works. Happy camper.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a pretty area of Del Mar; close to Sea World.”
Reviews.Author: azpinoyingilbert
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel with nice amenities. One thing that I remember the most is how quiet it was at night, save for a low humming sound of some sort, not sure. I didn't hear any banging or shouting or noise from other rooms around us and it was Memorial Day weekend! This was great after a long day at Sea World! The neighborhood was very clean, serene, and beautiful. There was a Vons just about 2 minutes away, around the neighborhood. Torrey Pines Beach was only 10 minutes away. Also, it was five minutes away from a Catholic Church and about 15 minutes away from Sea World. Inside, the hotel room had everything we needed, from the microwave to the mini fridge. The flat screen TV was adequate but I guess I'm spoiled by our bigger TV at home. I didn't bring my laptop but the room was equipped with free wi-fi connection. The bathroom was a nice size and clean. Overall, the room was comfortable. The fitness room was smaller than what I've seen in other hotels but I was able to get a quick workout on the smooth elliptical machine. You would have to get up early to get on one of the machines. We didn't use the heated pool or jacuzzi but they were available. Nice extras were cookies at the checkout desk and coffee in the mornings. I know this was a Hilton but I wish breakfast was included although $10.95 was a reasonable price. This was a very nice hotel that I would definitely go to again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Restaurant, Great Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: kkathleen
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Garden Inn had a nice, easy check in and out. There are many ammenities on the hotel property includign a full spa, where i received a great haircut, a peet's coffee and an excellent bar and restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, frieldly staff, comfortable bed, good TV”
Reviews.Author: Dontasky
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and bar/ resutrant. Staff is friedly and very helpful. Breakfast is expensive but there is a variety of fresh fruit. It would be nice if the bar stocked some local beers.

Reviews.Title: “nice view of highway 5”
Reviews.Author: emmy_7
Reviews.Content: Don't be deceived by the street name, Ocean Bluff, the only views here are of highway 5. But the hotel is clean and quiet and convenient for UCSD and Scripps Clinic.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied with Hilton Garden Inn!”
Reviews.Author: amshadow1
Reviews.Content: Me, my husband, and 2 year old daughter stayed here for 3 nights 9/15-9/18/09. We checked in very late/early in the morning but my husband was greeted promptly upon entering the lobby & check in was very smooth & speedy. We we pleasantly surprised when we got to our room at how nice it was and we already felt it was a good value for our money. The room was a little on the small side but still very comfortable. The bed was comfortable and could be adjusted for firmness/softness. The free internet worked great and the ethernet cable was already in the room if needed instead of having to ask for it at the front desk like most hotels. Loved having the microwave and mini fridge in the room, very convenient-especially with having a toddler traveling with us. The bathroom was pretty tiny which was really my only complaint with the room as a whole. It made getting ready a little more challenging. The hotel itself was very quiet, I never heard a peep from other guests our entire stay! Parking was free but sometimes hard to come by and spaces were a little tight (We have a full size SUV). The pool was small and the salon/spa looked out onto the pool area so my husband was not comfortable taking my daughter-he wished it had been a little more private. I'm sure if you are looking for more privacy it would be fine to use after the salon/spa closes for the day. Room service was excellent-both the service and food were great. Very friendly staff throughout our stay. The area itself was very quiet and removed which is good and bad. We found this to be a plus because it was quiet and felt very safe, but on the other hand it's a bit of a drive from most things. No fast food close by, etc... Did like the proximity to Torrey Pines State Beach (only about 5 minutes away) and Sea World was only about 15 minutes away so really not bad all in all. Overall we were happy with our stay here and would stay here again and recommend this hotel to others. The pros definitely outweighed the cons for us.

Reviews.Title: “A Refreshing Night”
Reviews.Author: TripInsider
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at several San Diego area properties, I would definitely choose to return to this one. It is a newer, well-managed and conveniently located HGI which was a very welcome stop after all day on the road. Amenities we liked were the free wireless, the stay fit kit (everything you need for a pilates or yoga workout plus a medicine ball!), the professional and most helpful front desk staff, the readily offered printouts of running paths and local directions. Deserving special mention is Bistro 39, which offered a very nice, very good value 4 course prix fixe dinner-with a wine list. We did not have to drive any further to find dinner and were very pleased with the choices, including for us, cioppino, fresh salads, hearty appetizers (calamari with different dipping sauces and chicken on a skewer) and a great chocolate dessert! Also of note was the "garden sleep system." On each side of the mattress, tucked into a velcro-closed flap is a dial that allows the sleeper to choose the firmness of the mattress. It really worked! We also liked the ergonomic Herman Miller desk chair. After our overnight stay at this HGI, we actually felt refreshed and ready to get back into the car for another day on the road!

Reviews.Title: “15 minute drive away from city but worth it”
Reviews.Author: gypsyrunaway
Reviews.Content: This hotel was far from the city center, but easily accessible off the hwy. The neighborhood is upscale. The hotel staff (front desk in particular) was very helpful and accomodating. Free fresh cookies and fruit every day at counter. Room was good size to fit 4 of us. Bed was adjustable for both occupants. Clean and somewhat modern decor. Business center nice with 2 computers. Pool is small, whirlpool is typical. No comlimentary breakfast unfortunately. Very good price for what you get. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay...Garden Inn worked out perfect”
Reviews.Author: alohafan
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel. It had everything we needed for a quick weekend away. The rooms are nice with a very comfortable bed. The restaurant had a small bar that was packed on Friday night - must be the place to be in the neighborhood. Location was convenient for everything we did - going to Coronado and to La Jolla. I wouldn't make this a place for a long vacation, but as a comfortable place to stay while exploring the San Diego area, it's great.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: talis1115
Reviews.Content: Hilton Garden Inn Del Mar is a very nice hotel. Great facilities such as a gym and the pool was fantastic.. The breakfast was very good food with a large variety to pick from. It was not too far from San Diego city which was a bonus..(10 minute drive.) Front counter service was good but i have had better. The food we ordered for room service was fantastic. Very tasty and fresh food but once again service was average as the guy who delivered the food had an attitude so i only gave minimal tip.. The beds were the most comfortable beds i have ever slept on in a hotel. I would recommend this hotel very highly but don't expect super service, it was probably the most disappointing service we received in any hotel on our trip. Having said that, the service was not bad it was just that other hotels were really fantastic..

Reviews.Title: “Reviews Were Correct - Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaulistaTravel
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel - mainly for the quality and value - combined with the fairly good reviews on this site. The last time I was in San Diego I stayed at the Marriott downtown for three times the price - and I can´t say I got a much better experience there for three times the price! This hotel had all that I needed with a good location. I would not say it is a palace, but it is the best you can find of the Hilton spinoff "Garden Inns" that I have stayed at - that simply includes all that I (or probably anyone) needs in a hotel. I agree that the staff was especially friendly - seems like a very well organized customer oriented team. This place is a good bet if you can afford to be a few miles north of downtown San Diego, and then get a bonus of a healthy walk on beautiful Del Mar beach.

Reviews.Title: “Second time as good as the first!”
Reviews.Author: OneVegasGuy
Reviews.Content: It's certainly a pleasure to stay at this property. I have stayed here twice now and will again. It's convenient, and affordable. Their staff is outstanding and accommodating - they make you feel welcome! I arrived early (10am) for an afternoon event and they allowed me to check in. The whole property is clean. The rooms are large. They have a convenient fitness center and the restaurant is good, too. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CanadaDave36
Reviews.Content: This place is convenient for business in the Sorrento Valley/Golden Triangle area. It is a great Hilton Garden Inn with a staff that goes the extra mile. I agree with the other revues on the restaurant - unexpected great food - and a nice lounge adjoining it. We have a few Garden Inn in Edmonton that don't even come close to this one. You can tell that these guys are trying so hard to run a great hotel. I had some heavy equipment and luggage that I was getting out to my rental car. One guy from the hotel ran out and insisted on helping me out. When I offered him a tip, the guy shook my hand and imtroduced himself as the owner and general manager and said "just come back again!" Now that deserved a review on Tripadvisor!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent bar, food and drinks”
Reviews.Author: dmbarry
Reviews.Content: Good atmosphere and great food at the bar. I couldn't believe the prices, they were so reasonable! Rooms are very comfortable, especially the adjustable beds. Everything was really clean and the service was great. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat stay was fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Noreasterner
Reviews.Content: Although I have personally used the reviews on Trip Advisor many times before, I have never posted a review. But felt, after staying at this location in May 2008 and again in March 2009, that I needed to tip my hat to the folks that make this place great. Each day I walked through the doors in the lobby, I was greeted by multiple staff and felt very welcomed. This happened each and every time I passed by the desk. The staff were very knowledgeable about the greater San Diego area as well when I asked a few questions. The quality of the food at the restaurant was superior, as was the service. The one night I asked for extra towels while downstairs at the front desk after having dinner at the restaurant. I wasn't in my room for more than 2 minutes and the towels were already delivered to my room. The business center has 2 computers that have lightning-fast free internet service with Windows Vista, along with a printer. Although, I must agree with an earlier review that the comfort level of the beds were not out-of-this-world, they were suffice. The room had a flat screen tv with sharp picture quality and the room was very clean, as was the hotel in general. In the evening, the hotel had a variety of freshly made cookies on the counter at the front desk and complimentary coffee. Although I am not a coffee afficionado, my wife, who is from Brazil and quite picky when it comes to her tastes for coffee, made a comment to me about the quality of the coffee, saying it tasted like the coffee from Brazil. Also, the fitness center was great and had free weights. Oh, and I almost forgot to mention, the hotel also has a nice bar in the lobby alongside the restaurant and had a daily happy hour from 3pm to 6pm. We ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant each day. Continental buffet breakfast was $5.95 and the full hot breakfast buffet was $10.95. So in summary, this hotel really pays attention to the details and gets it right---especially the little things that are often times overlooked. Kudos to the management! When staying in the Del Mar/La Jolla area again, I will only stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Not for light sleepers”
Reviews.Author: tesspers
Reviews.Content: The staff are all attentive, friendly, and eager to please. Dinner was surprisingly good. The location was excellent for our purposes (the company with whom we were doing business is just minutes away). The property is clean, and there are 2 computers in the business center. The gym is small, but does the job. The bar gives a generous wine pour. On the other hand, this place is pretty noisy. The TV sets are on the same wall that the headboards of the beds are situated on in the next room. Thus, you are forced to listen to the sounds of your neighbor's TV viewing choices for as late into the night as they keep the TV turned on. Additionally, there is a strange wind tunnel sound in the bathroom 24/7, which is like the bass amplified noise you hear from some of those obnoxious sound systems featuring subwoofers. Closing the bathroom door helps somewhat, but not entirely. I found the constant vibration left me feeling nauseous. To top it off, my room, on the 2nd floor, was located directly above the service delivery doors. At 4:45 am, a big truck pulled up, left its motor running for 40 minutes and proceeded to unload a wide variety of things that clink and clank and bang. The beds are really firm. You can supposedly make adjustments, but turning the dial to "softer" didn't seem to make a whit of difference. After 2 nights in this hotel, I was so sleep deprived I could barely function. So despite all the good things about it (staff, location, good food, reasonable price), I will probably not return.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Cycleboy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while in town to visit familiy and do some sight seeing. The hotel is conveniently located right off of I-5, yet is protected from a lot of the highway noise. This is a new hotel, so things are still settling down a little but I found the staff to be very friendly and accomodating. No major complaints at all..

HotelInfo.Name: Hilton Garden Inn San Diego Del Mar
HotelInfo.Address: 3939 Ocean Bluff Ave, San Diego, CA 92130
